DataElement.preferredDefinition: The upright measurement of a positive observation in an imaging study.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A positive observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganismas a result of an imaging study.  [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:An observation confirming something, such as the
presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Property.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/6/12 jc  Add to ACRIN Image Finding CSI; remove from caBIG ACRIN CSI.  9/17/07 - released for reuse by C3PR.  3/20/07 - Created to support ACRIN Breast CDE development task; 3/14/07-updated for EVS term recommendation.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Upright in position or posture._Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Upright in position or posture.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/7/13 unretired for reuse by BOLD. jc 11/6/12 jc Retired as part of ACRIN draft content review with Tina Taylor; association with caBIG ACRIN CSI removed so CSI can be retired. 3/26/07 - Created to support ACRIN Breast CDE development task.

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
